verses.text: I Lift up my eyes to you, who are throned in the heavens.
As the eyes of a servant turn to the hand of his master, or the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress, so do our eyes turn to the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*our God, until he is gracious to us.
Be gracious, be gracious to us, \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*. Scorn enough, and more, have we borne
More than enough have we borne of derision from those at their ease, of scorn from those who are haughty.
